doc.previous: The wide, shallow seas of the Carboniferous Period provided ideal conditions for coal formation, although coal is known from most geological periods. The exception is the coal gap in the PermianâTriassic extinction event, where coal is rare. Coal is known from Precambrian strata, which predate land plants â this coal is presumed to have originated from residues of algae.[13][14]
